title: Famous Generals Recall
description: Test your knowledge of history's greatest military commanders!

questions.question: Which American general commanded Allied forces on D-Day and later became president?
questions.explanation: Dwight D. Eisenhower served as Supreme Commander of Allied forces in Europe and oversaw the D-Day invasion. He later became the 34th US President.

questions.question: Which Confederate general was known as the greatest tactician of the American Civil War?
questions.explanation: Robert E. Lee commanded the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia and is widely regarded as one of the greatest military tacticians in American history.

questions.question: Which French military leader crowned himself Emperor in 1804?
questions.explanation: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor of France on December 2, 1804, at Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris.

questions.question: Which Union general accepted Robert E. Lee's surrender at Appomattox Court House?
questions.explanation: General Ulysses S. Grant accepted Lee's surrender on April 9, 1865, effectively ending the American Civil War.

questions.question: Which British general defeated Napoleon at the Battle of Waterloo?
questions.explanation: The Duke of Wellington (Arthur Wellesley) defeated Napoleon at Waterloo on June 18, 1815, ending Napoleon's Hundred Days return to power.

questions.question: Which American general famously said 'I shall return' when leaving the Philippines in WWII?
questions.explanation: General Douglas MacArthur made this famous promise when ordered to leave the Philippines in 1942, and he fulfilled it by returning in 1944.

questions.question: Which Mongol conqueror built the largest contiguous land empire in history?
questions.explanation: Genghis Khan united the Mongol tribes and conquered vast territories stretching from China to Eastern Europe in the 13th century.

questions.question: Which WWII American general was known as 'Old Blood and Guts'?
questions.explanation: General George S. Patton earned the nickname 'Old Blood and Guts' for his aggressive and bold military leadership during World War II.

questions.question: Which British field marshal led the Eighth Army to victory at El Alamein in 1942?
questions.explanation: Field Marshal Bernard Montgomery ('Monty') led the British Eighth Army to a decisive victory over Rommel's Afrika Korps at El Alamein in 1942.

questions.question: Which German general was known as 'The Desert Fox'?
questions.explanation: Erwin Rommel earned the nickname 'The Desert Fox' for his cunning tactics commanding the Afrika Korps in North Africa during WWII.

questions.question: Which ancient Roman general reformed the army and was elected consul seven times?
questions.explanation: Gaius Marius reformed the Roman army into a professional fighting force and was elected consul an unprecedented seven times.

questions.question: Which French general led the Free French Forces during World War II?
questions.explanation: Charles de Gaulle led the Free French Forces from London during WWII and later became President of France.

questions.question: Which Soviet general led the defense of Stalingrad?
questions.explanation: General Vasily Chuikov commanded the 62nd Army during the brutal defense of Stalingrad, fighting from building to building against the Germans.

questions.question: Which Prussian general helped the Duke of Wellington at Waterloo?
questions.explanation: Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher led the Prussian army that arrived at Waterloo in time to help Wellington defeat Napoleon decisively.

questions.question: Which Roman general defeated Hannibal at the Battle of Zama in 202 BC?
questions.explanation: Scipio Africanus defeated Hannibal at the Battle of Zama, ending the Second Punic War and earning his honorary name 'Africanus.'
